content.p: Find the accommodation that's right for you Situated in the north area of University Park campus, Cripps Hall comprises 373 student rooms. The Students' Union and Hallward Library are among some of the social facilities nearby. In Cripps Lower Annexe, we offer Quieter Living accommodation. Join Politics student Maddie on a tour of Cripps Hall and its surrounding facilities. Here you'll have the choice of a quieter, more laid back experience in Lower Cripps, or a more vibrant, social atmosphere in the main Hall. Accommodation is guaranteed for the first year. For added peace of mind, free cancellation, no penalties if you do not obtain your grades, defer* your place, or are unable to obtain a visa. See full terms and conditions. Your Residential Experience Team (ResX) is available 7 days a week, from the day you arrive, until the day you leave, to support you to settle and thrive in your new home, and the fantastic community that you will belong to as a student at the University of Nottingham. Helping you make the most of your time in halls we host a range of events from big to small to help you connect with others and enjoy your time in halls. Our events are aimed to help you thrive in halls and develop as a person, learn a new skill or just have some fun. We offer a supportive and non-judgemental wellbeing service for all our hall students. We can help with a wide range of issues and challenges that you are facing. Highlighting the amazing community we are a part of and setting expectations of behaviour across our halls. Available in Quieter Living accommodation only, on a 39-week contract. Also available in Quiet Living Sharing a bathroom and living area (with food heating facilities) with one other student Living room with area providing food heating facilities Our catered Meal Plans offer healthy, tasty, freshly cooked food for diverse dietary requirements. We use sustainable and quality-assured ingredients like free-range eggs, Red Tractor-assured meat and sustainably farmed fish. Halls with 39-week contracts get 35 weeks of catering, and 31-week contracts receive 31 weeks of catering. Both include 12 meals per week. Your Meal Plan includes: You can find all of our meal times across the year here. *Please note no catering is provided over the winter vacation period and limited on-campus retail stores are open during this time. In partnership with UoN Sport and as Sports University of the year 2024, the Active Living package provides exclusive sport, fitness and active events for students living in University halls on University Park and Jubilee campus, plus Dagfa and Varsity. Included within your accommodation, your Active Living package offers some incredible perks. Access our sports and fitness suites across our campuses and across the nation with the BUCS UNIversal scheme. Join in some casual sports with Just Play or get competitive with the Inter-Mural Sports teams. Plus a programme of exclusive sessions and events just for you and your new hall mates! Close to bus stops for the free on-campus University Hopper bus to Jubilee Campus, close to bus stops and tram stops for access to the city centre. If applying for quieter living accommodation, students do so on the basis they will need to show extra consideration to their neighbours in keeping noise to a minimum wherever possible. Applicants who do not request quieter living accommodation will not be assigned to it. In this designated quieter living accommodation, all students are happy to support the expectation that after 9pm, no avoidable noise or music should be heard in adjacent corridors or rooms. To finalise your offer, you will be required to read and accept a licence/tenancy agreement and terms and conditions from your accommodation provider University of Nottingham. We highly recommend that you read this along with a parent, guardian, carer or school representative, as this is a legally binding document. You will be accepting liability for the full tenancy length of 39 weeks including vacation periods. Once you have moved in you are liable to pay for the duration of your licence period.
